attributes.action: cease proceedings for the Interception Modernisation Programme, and to reject calls for legislation allowing the Programme access to personal electronic data of British Citizens.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Interception Modernisation Programme is a Government initiative that, if passed, would give the Government access to every email and text message sent in the UK. It would also allow them to monitor the internet use of every individual.

The ethical implications of such a programme are clear; privacy will no longer have a place in our society. As one of the most basic human rights, this is unacceptable.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "cease proceedings for the Interception Modernisation Programme, and to reject calls for legislation allowing the Programme access to personal electronic data of British Citizens."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page18637


Prime Minister's Office
